We have seen improvements in our construction contractors safety behaviors and a reduction in near misses since implementing this program. The safety committee continues to work with the HSE department to identify more opportunities to grow our safety culture.

Facility Location
Pinnacle Dos Picos Gas Plant would like to note that we chose a remote, unpopulated location for our facility in order to minimize impact on the general public.

t team is quite experienced with a high level of commitment to safety and environmental excellence.

The emergency response program
Pinnacle Dos Picos Gas Plant has an extensive emergency response plan and is currently working with first responders to not only work with them on emergency mock drills and training but to give them tours of our plant as well to ensure they have a good emergency understanding of it. All of our plant based employees go through initial and annual emergency response training as well. Our emergency response plan includes the below categories of information.
-	Purpose
-	Introduction
-	Notification process
-	Evacuations
-	Establishing and Maintaining Adequate Means of Communication with Police, Fire and other Public Officials
-	Medical facilities
-	Reporting agency contact information
-	Public relations
-	Prompt and Effective Response to Each Type of Emergency
-	What to do for a gas release
-	What to do for a liquid spill/release
-	Fire or explosion occurring at or near the facility
-	What to do in the event of various natural disasters
-	What to do for a transportation related incident
-	How to address workplace violence or a civil dispute
-	What to do in the event of a bomb threat
-	What to do in the event of a medical emergency or personal injury
-	What to do in case of a fatality
-	What to do in case of a loss of limb or three or more hospitalizations
-	Availability of Personnel, Equipment, Tools, and Materials
-	Priority of actions
-	Emergency shutdown and pressure reduction procedures
-	Emergency response training requirements

Planned changes to improve safety
To date Pinnacle has had zero recordable injuries, however we are always looking for opportunities to continue to improve our safety culture. Recently, with full support of the executive team, we have formed a safety committee made up primarily of non-HSE personnel to create a safety culture by the employees for the employees. The safety committee has implemented an award program

description and the regulated substances handled
The Pinnacle Dos Picos Gas Plant is a natural gas processing facility in which unprocessed natural gas is brought in via pipeline and processed to two main product streams, natural gas(98% methane) and Natural Gas Liquids (this is a mixed stream of the heavier than methane hydrocarbons). The processing of the natural gas also uses a propane refrigeration system which holds 17,600 gallons of propane or 85,712 pounds. In regard to the natural gas and NGLs there are approximately 158,607 pounds of hydrocarbon gasses in the plant at any given time and 512,456 pounds of hydrocarbon liquids in the plant at any given time in addition to the propane refrigeration. These numbers can fluctuate slightly at any given time based on the nature of unprocessed natural gas.

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps
The Pinnacle Does Picos Gas Plant fully complies with all 14 elements of the OSHA PSM requirements outlined in 1910.119. Additionally, the plant complies with all 40 CFR 112 requirements for SPCC. All plant employees participate in both monthly and annual trainings as well as a gambit of new hire training upon joining the company. Additionally, the plant is planning to complete annual emergency mock drills once in service. Some of these mock drills will include agencies such as the local fire department. The Pinnacle Dos Picos Gas Plant is manned 24/7 with operators monitoring all systems from the control room as well as completing regular rounds through the plant on every shift.

The five-year accident history
The Pinnacle Dos Picos Gas Plant is new construction and not yet in service at time of RMP filing in August of 2022 so there is no five-year accident history. However, Pinnacle Dos Picos first began building assets in November 2020. In the near two years of operations, Pinnacle has had zero recordable injuries and zero reportable hazardous chemical spills. Pinnacle Dos Picos Gas Plant RMP Executive Summary

The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the Pinnacle Dos Picos Gas Plant
The Pinnacle Dos Picos Gas Plant is governed by multiple safety and environmental policies and plans. Included are a detailed emergency response plan, an environmental response plan, a health and safety manual, a site-specific OSHA PSM program, a site specific spill prevention control and countermeasures (SPCC) plan, as well as an overall commitment to safety from upper management which is included below. Additionally, as part of the overall safety program, employees are required to participate in monthly safety training in which a different topic is addressed each month. The facility will also occasionally hold mock emergency drills once the plant is up and running.

“Management Commitment to Safety 
Pinnacle Midstream is committed to provide all employees with a safe and healthy work environment. Accident prevention and safety must be made an integral part of everyday operations. No job must ever become so routine or so urgent to not observe all safety precautions. Prevention of personal injury and damage to the property and equipment of the Company and its customers must always remain uppermost in the mind of every employee. 

Safe working conditions will be maintained through safety training, the acquisition and use of safety equipment, implementation of safety policies and adequate supervision. 
Every employee of the Company is responsible for maintaining safe working conditions. Employees must develop safe work habits, properly use safety equipment, and report hazardous work conditions. 

Managers/Supervisors will instruct employees on safety practices and review their work for compliance with safety policies. The Company supervisors/field techs will receive the full support of management in carrying out the established safety guidelines. 

Greg Sargent 
CEO 
Pinnacle Midstream”

Pinnacle Dos Picos Gas Plant
